issues.message:
[Error] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons
  How to fix:
    - Add aria-label to parent button
    - Add visually-hidden text
    - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative
  WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility
  Found: <mat-icon>close</mat-icon>

[Error] aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit
  How to fix:
    - Add element with matching id
    - Correct the id reference
    - Remove the broken reference
  WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing
  Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories"

[Warning] Content may be hidden without visual indication in "Visually hidden utility for screen reader only content
.visually-hidden". Text content may be cut off and inaccessible to users.
  How to fix:
    - Add "text-overflow: ellipsis" to show truncation indicator (...)
    - Or remove "overflow: hidden" to allow text to wrap naturally
    - Or ensure content is accessible through other means (tooltips, expand buttons)
  WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

[Info] Potential content overflow detected in "h3". This may hide text content inaccessibly.
  How to fix:
    - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden
    - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content
    - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width
  WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

    - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width
  WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

[Info] Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements.
  How to fix:
    - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors
    - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles
    - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused
    - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; }
    - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible
  WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible
  Found: Complex containers (.card-arrow)

[Warning] Font size 11px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision
  How to fix:
    - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text
    - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability
    - Test at 200% zoom
  WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text
  Found: ".chip-count"
